trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for iOS apps
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Services for iOS apps

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for iOS development.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Mobile Services for iOS development.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an iOS app using Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an iOS app using Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The mobile service that you will create uses JavaScript for server-side business logic.
trans-unit.target: The mobile service that you will create uses JavaScript for server-side business logic.

trans-unit.source: To create a mobile service with server-side business logic in .NET, see the [.NET backend version] of this topic.
trans-unit.target: To create a mobile service with server-side business logic in .NET, see the [.NET backend version] of this topic.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get <linkText>free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get <linkText>free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mcid=AE564AB28&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdevelop%2Fmobile%2Ftutorials%2Fget-started-ios%2F%20 target="blank").
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mcid=AE564AB28&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdevelop%2Fmobile%2Ftutorials%2Fget-started-ios%2F%20 target="blank").

trans-unit.source: You can follow an easy Quick Start in the Management Portal to create a new app connected to your mobile service:
trans-unit.target: You can follow an easy Quick Start in the Management Portal to create a new app connected to your mobile service:

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the Quick Start tab, click iOS under Choose a platform and expand Create a new iOS app.
trans-unit.target: In the Quick Start tab, click iOS under Choose a platform and expand Create a new iOS app.

trans-unit.source: This displays the steps to create an iOS app connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This displays the steps to create an iOS app connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click Create TodoItem table to create a table to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Click Create TodoItem table to create a table to store app data.

trans-unit.source: Under Download and run your app, click Download.
trans-unit.target: Under Download and run your app, click Download.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service, along with the Mobile Services iOS SDK.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service, along with the Mobile Services iOS SDK.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you saved it.

trans-unit.source: 1. Back in the Management Portal, click the DATA tab and then click the TodoItem table. This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.
trans-unit.target: 1. Back in the Management Portal, click the DATA tab and then click the TodoItem table. This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source:
[Add mobile services to an existing app]
Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target:
[Add mobile services to an existing app]
Learn more about storing and querying data using Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with offline data sync]
Learn how to use offline data sync to make your app responsive and robust.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with offline data sync]
Learn how to use offline data sync to make your app responsive and robust.

trans-unit.source:
[Add authentication to an existing app]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target:
[Add authentication to an existing app]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source:
[Add push notifications to an existing app]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Add push notifications to an existing app]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
